skill.name: azure-ai
skill.description: Use for Azure AI: Search, Speech, OpenAI, Document Intelligence. Helps with search, vector/hybrid search, speech-to-text, text-to-speech, transcription, OCR. USE FOR: AI Search, query search, vector search, hybrid search, semantic search, speech-to-text, text-to-speech, transcribe, OCR, convert text to speech. DO NOT USE FOR: Function apps/Functions (use azure-functions), databases (azure-postgres/azure-kusto), general Azure resources.
skill.summary: Comprehensive Azure AI services reference for Search, Speech, OpenAI, Document Intelligence, and Vision
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: All 195 static findings are false positives. The skill contains documentation with code examples for Azure AI SDK usage. Detected patterns (external_commands, env_access, network) are Markdown formatting artifacts and standard SDK documentation patterns, not security vulnerabilities.

low_findings.title: False Positive: Shell Command Detection in Documentation
low_findings.description: 164 instances of 'external_commands' flagged backticks in Markdown code blocks. These are documentation examples (pip install, npm install), not executable code.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks are Markdown formatting for code blocks showing SDK installation commands. No actual shell execution occurs in this documentation skill.

low_findings.title: False Positive: Environment Variable Access in Documentation
low_findings.description: 8 instances flagged environment variable access (process.env.TRANSLATOR_SUBSCRIPTION_KEY). These are standard Azure SDK credential patterns shown in documentation.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Standard Azure SDK documentation showing authentication pattern. No credential exfiltration or actual execution.

low_findings.title: False Positive: Hardcoded URLs in Documentation
low_findings.description: 2 instances flagged hardcoded URLs. These are legitimate Microsoft Learn documentation links.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Links to official Azure documentation (learn.microsoft.com). No malicious network behavior.

low_findings.title: False Positive: Cryptographic Algorithm Detection
low_findings.description: 4 instances flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm'. Triggered by words like 'analysis', 'stemming', 'neutral' in documentation text.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Documentation contains words like 'analysis', 'neutral' that trigger heuristic false positives. No cryptographic code present.

content.value_statement: This skill provides comprehensive documentation and SDK references for Azure AI services including Search, Speech, OpenAI, Vision, Translation, and Document Intelligence. It helps developers quickly find the right APIs and code patterns for their AI solutions.
actual_capabilities: Full-text, vector, and hybrid search with Azure AI Search
Speech-to-text and text-to-speech with Azure Speech
GPT model access via Azure OpenAI
Document OCR and form extraction with Document Intelligence
Image analysis and captioning with Azure Vision
limitations: Requires valid Azure subscription and credentials
Service-specific quotas and rate limits apply
Some features require specific Azure regions
MCP server must be enabled for tool-based access

use_cases.title: Build intelligent search applications
use_cases.description: Create search experiences with semantic understanding using vector embeddings and hybrid search capabilities

use_cases.title: Add speech capabilities to apps
use_cases.description: Integrate real-time transcription and text-to-speech for accessibility and voice interfaces
use_cases.target_user: Developers adding voice features to applications

use_cases.title: Process documents at scale
use_cases.description: Extract text and data from PDFs, forms, and images using OCR and form recognition

prompt_templates.title: Basic search query
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use Azure AI Search to perform a vector search in Python?
prompt_templates.scenario: Find code examples for vector search implementation

prompt_templates.title: Speech transcription
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to transcribe audio files to text using Azure Speech service with Python

prompt_templates.title: Document extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the code to extract text from a PDF using Azure Document Intelligence in TypeScript?

prompt_templates.title: Image analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Give me an example of using Azure Vision Image Analysis to get captions and tags from an image URL

output_examples.input: How do I set up hybrid search combining keyword and vector search in Azure AI Search?
output_examples.output: Use the SearchClient with both search_text and vectorQueries. Configure a semantic configuration for best results. Example: client.search(search_text='query', vector_queries=[VectorizedQuery(vector=embedding, k_nearest=3, fields='embedding')])

output_examples.input: Show me how to authenticate with Azure OpenAI using the .NET SDK
output_examples.output: Use AzureKeyCredential with your endpoint and API key: var client = new OpenAIClient(new Uri(endpoint), new AzureKeyCredential(apiKey)); Then call client.GetChatCompletionsAsync with your deployment name.

best_practices: Use hybrid search combining keyword and vector queries for best relevance
Enable semantic ranking for natural language query understanding
Process documents in batches of 100-1000 for optimal performance
Use async clients for high-throughput scenarios
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode credentials - use environment variables or Azure Managed Identity
Avoid querying large datasets without pagination or batching
Do not skip error handling for API calls
Avoid using deprecated SDK versions - keep packages updated

faq.question: What is the difference between AI Search and Azure OpenAI?
faq.answer: AI Search provides search and indexing capabilities with vector support. Azure OpenAI provides access to GPT models for generative AI. They can be used together for RAG applications.

faq.question: Do I need an Azure subscription to use this skill?
faq.answer: Yes, Azure AI services require an Azure subscription. You can use free tiers for development, but production usage requires paid subscriptions.

faq.question: Can I use this skill offline?
faq.answer: No, Azure AI services are cloud-based and require network connectivity to access the APIs.

faq.question: Which programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Azure AI services support Python, TypeScript, Java, .NET, and Go. This skill includes quick reference guides for Python, TypeScript, .NET, and Java.

faq.question: How do I enable the MCP server for Azure AI?
faq.answer: Run /azure:setup or enable via /mcp command. The MCP server provides tool-based access to AI Search and Speech services.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for Azure AI services?
faq.answer: Rate limits vary by service and pricing tier. Check Azure portal for your specific limits. Use exponential backoff for retries.
